text: i love you for posting this
author: fault3k

text: Memorable yes, but there are others I'd recommend: virtually any of the songs you hear where you're NOT running through it because its a fucking often-tread plains area in between actually relevant areas
author: Stewie G

text: The battle system really saved this game, the Item creation was dreadful, and the plot was very unpopular, although i enjoyed it personally.
author: Joseph

text: Wirklich geiler Sound! Genauso wie das Spiel!
author: Chocobobo19

text: I liked this game's approach to the space opera setting by focusing on a few detailed planets instead of a bunch of generic planets. I also really liked Peppita, because her ice daggers did ridiculous damage and dancers are cool. But there were a lot of smaller problems that ended up making it feel a bit lackluster to me in the end.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: Third best music in the game, behind Rust Color and Chrysanthemum in Winter.
author: Solvanderlyn

text: This song seems familiar despite the fact I've never played this game. But then I noticed this game was composed by Motoi Sakuraba who also composed Golden Sun series. This is very similar to Golden Sun world map themes!
author: Kookosbanaani94

text: the plot twists in this game are massive :o
author: Franco Gutierrez

text:
I always hated the friggin' plot twist in this game. The only time ever I've been mad over a story. But the locations, atmosphere, music and gameplay made me finish the game, all those components are absolutely stellar!
All in all, I would say I really like this game. Even though the plot is infuriating...
author: Ozziw162

text: I'll always remember this game for having a massive trophy/achievement save file on the PS2 memory card.
author: Sephiko

text: This game worth playing for someone who loves SO 2? I tried the one that came out for 360 I believe # 4? Didn't like it too much. Great song btw.
author: Hogo69

text:
+Hogo69 SO3 is my favorite. It doesn't have the same type of atrocious characters from SO4, the gameplay is fun and addicting, the plot is engaging if you are into sci-fi and there is just so much bonus content and challenges in the extended version. The music is also unique and memorable.


Most people have only really one complaint about the game which has to do with a huge spoiler but I think it is pretty silly to negate all the positives of the game just because you don't like ONE thing that happens in the story. I actually liked the turn of the events myself.
author: AP3Brain

text:
Are there some star ocean games that I can download so I can play to them on my computer? 
I have a lot of emulators including GBA, SNES or PS1
author: actinid14

text: +Shinji Kuritō Yeah, ask for tips on what games to illegally download. Wonderful idea.
author: Burkhart von Klitzing

text:
+Burkhart von Klitzing Well I download all of them with Romstation and I have an account on it it's like a sort of steam so I think it's legal
And it would be hard for me to find some SNES games today in shops
Without that I would have never discovered chrono trigger or the fabulous ff6 I love it!
author: actinid14

text: +Burkhart von Klitzing And all of the emulators are given with Romstation
author: actinid14

text: +Shinji Kuritō Sorry to disappoint you but that is NOT legal. IF you own the game and the console then emulating is legal. I do it with some of my ps2 games since ps2 looks like crap on my HDTV..
author: Kaitengiri

text: +loghh Anyway it's way easier than seeking and buying the game when you can have it for free
author: actinid14

text: Motoi Sakuraba always does such epic soundtracks man. I'm a huge fan of his work since the first Valkyrie Profile and Star Ocean: The Second Story games.
author: Thelos Verlos

text: Though this game felt like a notable step in the wrong direction in almost every respect from SO2, and I still much prefer the latter's soundtrack too, there are definitely some memorable tracks here.
author: MrTwrule

text: muy buena eleccion parcero una de las mejores canciones que he escuchado.
author: darkrad27

text: Damn fine choice. This one is a personal favourite from SO3's superb soundtrack.
author: CerberusLives

text: More than 10 years later, I still associate this upbeat field theme with the hours of grinding I did in this game. The awesome battle system really helped here, I was never really bored even during those times. I'm glad they're making a 5th installment, hopefully it's better received than #4 which I have yet to play.
author: SupraDarky

text:
+SupraDarky Wish we were getting the PS3 version of 5 in the States :/


Great choice from 3!
author: Lung kisser

text: +SupraDarky Oh man the grinding was real in SO3, Despite having 6 characters at Lvl 255, I still couldn't beat Freya, either. I had forgotten about this field theme. Let's hope SO5 delivers.
author: JameboHayabusa

text: +SupraDarky While #4 isn't as good as #3 it is still worth a play. I thoroughly enjoyed my time playing it.
author: VictorVonFox

text: +SupraDarky I personally like 4 more than 3, but that of course, is just my opinion. But 2 is better than any of them, so there's that.
author: bloodyangel1

text: +SupraDarky I mean, I beat 4 but I don't think I could ever pick it up again. Mechanically it's fine but the game was a joke right from the first mention of the protagonists name and it was all downhill from there
author: Asuka0242

text:
+SupraDarky 
Best:    Star Ocean 2.
Worst: Star Ocean 4.

Of course, worst doesn't mean it's bad, just of the bunch it's the weakest when it comes to story and crafting, however, I did enjoy the fighting system, just not the new features like the dodgestep etc.
author: Vordox

text: +SupraDarky I would maybe give SO4 a try but it is definitely the worst in the series. The characters were atrocious and the plot wasn't nearly as engaging as SO3's but the actual gameplay was still fun.
author: AP3Brain

text: +SupraDarky I feel like I'm the only one that really liked #4. I loved all the entries (haven't played deep blue GBA for translation reasons).
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: +Bigrog1988 I honestly found the Story of 4 completely predictable at EVERY turn, esspecially the foreshadowing of a certain antagonist later on. It was so obvious it hurt.
author: Faldomar

text: +SupraDarky I liked SO3's story and crafting much much better, but I liked SO4's gameplay better. The combat was much easier and there's sprinting across fields to go faster. And the quiet footsteps. No stomping around on dirt ground.
author: dannywolfpero

text: SupraDarky the 4 was better than the crap star ocean 5 was
author: Dominic Guy
